        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

         * is disabled for this component.

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            <div>

        mr-issue-page {

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Nov 4, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Nov 4, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Nov 4, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Nov 4, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      The hci_error_reset and hci_rx_work are two worker threads, so there is a possibility of race conditions. hci_error_reset will eventually call device_del, hci_rx_work will eventually call device_add, so there is a race condition vulnerability between [0] and [1],[2]<span class="line"><!---->The hci_error_reset and hci_rx_work are two worker threads, so there is a possibility of race conditions. hci_error_reset will eventually call device_del, hci_rx_work will eventually call device_add, so there is a race condition vulnerability between [0] and [1],[2]<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/drivers/base/core.c;l=3571<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/drivers/base/core.c;l=3571"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/drivers/base/core.c;l=3571<!----></a><br>int device_add(struct device *dev)<span class="line"><!---->int device_add(struct device *dev)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct device *parent;<span class="line"><!---->	struct device *parent;<!----></span><br>	struct kobject *kobj;<span class="line"><!---->	struct kobject *kobj;<!----></span><br>	struct class_interface *class_intf;<span class="line"><!---->	struct class_interface *class_intf;<!----></span><br>	int error = -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->	int error = -EINVAL;<!----></span><br>	struct kobject *glue_dir = NULL;<span class="line"><!---->	struct kobject *glue_dir = NULL;<!----></span><br><br>	dev = get_device(dev);<span class="line"><!---->	dev = get_device(dev);<!----></span><br>	if (!dev)<span class="line"><!---->	if (!dev)<!----></span><br>		goto done;<span class="line"><!---->		goto done;<!----></span><br><br>	if (!dev->p) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (!dev-&gt;p) {<!----></span><br>		error = device_private_init(dev);<span class="line"><!---->		error = device_private_init(dev);<!----></span><br>		if (error)<span class="line"><!---->		if (error)<!----></span><br>			goto done;<span class="line"><!---->			goto done;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	/*<span class="line"><!---->	/*<!----></span><br>	 * for statically allocated devices, which should all be converted<span class="line"><!---->	 * for statically allocated devices, which should all be converted<!----></span><br>	 * some day, we need to initialize the name. We prevent reading back<span class="line"><!---->	 * some day, we need to initialize the name. We prevent reading back<!----></span><br>	 * the name, and force the use of dev_name()<span class="line"><!---->	 * the name, and force the use of dev_name()<!----></span><br>	 */<span class="line"><!---->	 */<!----></span><br>	if (dev->init_name) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (dev-&gt;init_name) {<!----></span><br>		dev_set_name(dev, "%s", dev->init_name);<span         You are right that we have the first patch in the series, I was searching for the second patch in the series:<span class="line"><!---->You are right that we have the first patch in the series, I was searching for the second patch in the series:<!----></span><br>https://lore.kernel.org/all/20220921055026.380196-1-yin31149@gmail.com/t/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.git.corp.google.com/chromiumos/third_party/kernel/+/7096daba731eea262e0f7bf03453ceddcad89f70%5E%21/#F0"><!---->https://chromium.git.corp.google.com/chromiumos/third_party/kernel/+/7096daba731eea262e0f7bf03453ceddcad89f70%5E%21/#F0<!----></a><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/net/bluetooth/hci_debugfs.c b/net/bluetooth/hci_debugfs.c<span class="line"><!---->diff --git a/net/bluetooth/hci_debugfs.c class="line"><!---->--- a/net/bluetooth/hci_debugfs.c<!----></span><br>+++ b/net/bluetooth/hci_debugfs.c<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/net/bluetooth/hci_debugfs.c<!----></span><br>@@ -1245,7 +1245,7 @@<span class="line"><!---->@@ -1245,7 +1245,7 @@<!----></span><br> 	struct hci_dev *hdev = conn->hdev;<span class="line"><!----> 	struct hci_dev *hdev = conn-&gt;hdev;<!----></span><br> 	char name[6];<span class="line"><!----> 	char name[6];<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>-	if (IS_ERR_OR_NULL(hdev->debugfs))<span class="line"><!---->-	if (IS_ERR_OR_NULL(hdev-&gt;debugfs))<!----></span><br>+	if (IS_ERR_OR_NULL(hdev->debugfs) || conn->debugfs)<span class="line"><!---->+	if (IS_ERR_OR_NULL(hdev-&gt;debugfs) || conn-&gt;debugfs)<!----></span><br> 		return;<span class="line"><!----> 		return;<!----></span><br> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br> 	snprintf(name, sizeof(name), "%u", conn->handle);<span class="line"><!----> 	snprintf(name, sizeof(name), "%u", conn-&gt;handle);<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Nov 4, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Nov 4, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Nov 4, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Nov 4, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      The hci_error_reset and hci_rx_work are two worker threads, so there is a possibility of race conditions. hci_error_reset will eventually call device_del, hci_rx_work will eventually call device_add, so there is a race condition vulnerability between [0] and [1],[2]<span class="line"><!---->The hci_error_reset and hci_rx_work are two worker threads, so there is a possibility of race conditions. hci_error_reset will eventually call device_del, hci_rx_work will eventually call device_add, so there is a race condition vulnerability between [0] and [1],[2]<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/drivers/base/core.c;l=3571<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/drivers/base/core.c;l=3571"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/drivers/base/core.c;l=3571<!----></a><br>int device_add(struct device *dev)<span class="line"><!---->int device_add(struct device *dev)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct device *parent;<span class="line"><!---->	struct device *parent;<!----></span><br>	struct kobject *kobj;<span class="line"><!---->	struct kobject *kobj;<!----></span><br>	struct class_interface *class_intf;<span class="line"><!---->	struct class_interface *class_intf;<!----></span><br>	int error = -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->	int error = -EINVAL;<!----></span><br>	struct kobject *glue_dir = NULL;<span class="line"><!---->	struct kobject *glue_dir = NULL;<!----></span><br><br>	dev = get_device(dev);<span class="line"><!---->	dev = get_device(dev);<!----></span><br>	if (!dev)<span class="line"><!---->	if (!dev)<!----></span><br>		goto done;<span class="line"><!---->		goto done;<!----></span><br><br>	if (!dev->p) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (!dev-&gt;p) {<!----></span><br>		error = device_private_init(dev);<span class="line"><!---->		error = device_private_init(dev);<!----></span><br>		if (error)<span class="line"><!---->		if (error)<!----></span><br>			goto done;<span class="line"><!---->			goto done;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	/*<span class="line"><!---->	/*<!----></span><br>	 * for statically allocated devices, which should all be converted<span class="line"><!---->	 * for statically allocated devices, which should all be converted<!----></span><br>	 * some day, we need to initialize the name.         448a496f7606 should address the symptoms of this problem. It won't address the root cause; that is hidden somewhere in the bluetooth code. The error handler is known to be racy, and the bluetooth code should under no circumstance attempt to create the same sysfs attribute file twice.<span class="line"><!---->448a496f7606 should address the symptoms of this problem. It won't address the root cause; that is hidden somewhere in the bluetooth code.         You are right that we have the first patch in the series, I was searching for the second patch in the series:<span class="line"><!---->You are right that we have the first patch in the series, class="undefined" target="_blank"         And this is a local kernel privilege escalation vulnerability, not a code execution vulnerability. The key point is to escalate privileges.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Nov 4, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Nov 4, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Nov 4, 2022)

      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Nov 4, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      The hci_error_reset and hci_rx_work are two worker threads, so there is a possibility of race conditions. hci_error_reset will eventually call device_del, hci_rx_work will eventually call device_add, so there is a race condition vulnerability between [0] and [1],[2]<span class="line"><!---->The hci_error_reset and hci_rx_work are two worker threads, so there is a possibility of race conditions. hci_error_reset will eventually call device_del, hci_rx_work will eventually call device_add, so there is a race condition vulnerability between [0] and [1],[2]<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/drivers/base/core.c;l=3571<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/drivers/base/core.c;l=3571"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/drivers/base/core.c;l=3571<!----></a><br>int device_add(struct device *dev)<span class="line"><!---->int device_add(struct device *dev)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct device *parent;<span class="line"><!---->	struct device *parent;<!----></span><br>	struct kobject *kobj;<span class="line"><!---->	struct kobject *kobj;<!----></span><br>	struct class_interface *class_intf;<span class="line"><!---->	struct class_interface *class_intf;<!----></span><br>	int error = -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->	int error = -EINVAL;<!----></span><br>	struct kobject *glue_dir = NULL;<span class="line"><!---->	struct kobject *glue_dir = NULL;<!----></span><br><br>	dev = get_device(dev);<span class="line"><!---->	dev = get_device(dev);<!----></span><br>	if (!dev)<span class="line"><!---->	if (!dev)<!----></span><br>		goto done;<span class="line"><!---->		goto done;<!----></span><br><br>	if (!dev->p) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (!dev-&gt;p) {<!----></span><br>		error = device_private_init(dev);<span class="line"><!---->		error = device_private_init(dev);<!----></span><br>		if (error)<span class="line"><!---->		if (error)<!----></span><br>			goto done;<span class="line"><!---->			goto done;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	/*<span class="line"><!---->	/*<!----></span><br>	 * for statically allocated devices, which should all be converted<span class="line"><!---->	 * for statically allocated devices, which should all be converted<!----></span><br>	 * some day, we need to initialize the name. We prevent reading back<span class="line"><!---->	 * some day, we need to initialize the name. We prevent reading back<!----></span><br>	 * the name, and force the use of dev_name()<span class="line"><!---->	 * the name, and force the use of dev_name()<!----></span><br>	 */<span class="line"><!---->	 */<!----></span><br>	if (dev->init_name) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (dev-&gt;init_name) {<!----></span><br>		dev_set_name(dev, "%s", dev->init_name);<span class="line"><!---->		dev_set_name(dev, "%s", dev-&gt;init_name);<!----></span><br>		dev->init_name = NULL;<span class="line"><!---->		dev-&gt;init_name = NULL;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	/* subsystems can specify simple device enumeration */<span class="line"><!---->	/* subsystems can specify simple device enumeration */<!----></span><br>	if (!dev_name(dev) && dev->bus && dev->bus->dev_name)<span class="line"><!---->	if (!dev_name(dev) &amp;&amp; dev-&gt;bus &amp;&amp; dev-&gt;bus-&gt;dev_name)<!----></span><br>		dev_set_name(dev, "%s%u", dev->bus->dev_name, dev->id);<span class="line"><!---->		dev_set_name(dev, "%s%u", dev-&gt;bus-&gt;dev_name, dev-&gt;id);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!dev_name(dev)) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (!dev_name(dev)) {<!----></span><br>		error = -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		error = -EINVAL;<!----></span><br>		goto name_error;<span class="line"><!---->		goto name_error;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	pr_debug("device: '%s': %s\n", dev_name(dev), __func__);<span class="line"><!---->	pr_debug("device: '%s': %s\n", dev_name(dev), __func__);<!----></span><br><br>	parent = get_device(dev->parent);<span class="line"><!---->	parent = get_device(dev-&gt;parent);<!----></span><br>	kobj = get_device_parent(dev, parent);<span class="line"><!---->	kobj = get_device_parent(dev, parent);<!----></span><br>	if (IS_ERR(kobj)) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (IS_ERR(kobj)) {<!----></span><br>		error = PTR_ERR(kobj);<span class="line"><!---->		error = PTR_ERR(kobj);<!----></span><br>		goto parent_error;<span class="line"><!---->		goto parent_error;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br>	if (kobj)<span class="line"><!---->	if (kobj)<!----></span><br>		dev->kobj.parent = kobj;<span class="line"><!---->		dev-&gt;kobj.parent = kobj;<!----></span><br><br>	/* use parent numa_node */<span class="line"><!---->	/* use parent numa_node */<!----></span><br>	if (parent && (dev_to_node(dev) == NUMA_NO_NODE))<span class="line"><!---->	if (parent &amp;&amp; (dev_to_node(dev) == NUMA_NO_NODE))<!----></span><br>		set_dev_node(dev, dev_to_node(parent));<span class="line"><!---->		set_dev_node(dev, dev_to_node(parent));<!----></span><br><br>	/* first, register with generic layer. */<span class="line"><!---->	/* first, register with generic layer. */<!----></span><br>	/* we require the name to be set before, and pass NULL */<span class="line"><!---->	/* we require the name to be set before, and pass NULL */<!----></span><br>	error = kobject_add(&dev->kobj, dev->kobj.parent, NULL);<span class="line"><!---->	error = kobject_add(&amp;dev-&gt;kobj, dev-&gt;kobj.parent, NULL);<!----></span><br>	if (error) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (error) {<!----></span><br>		glue_dir = get_glue_dir(dev);<span class="line"><!---->		glue_dir = get_glue_dir(dev);<!----></span><br>		goto Error;<span class="line"><!---->		goto Error;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	/* notify platform of device entry */<span class="line"><!---->	/* notify platform of device entry */<!----></span><br>	device_platform_notify(dev);<span class="line"><!---->	device_platform_notify(dev);<!----></span><br><br>	error = device_create_file(dev, &dev_attr_uevent);<span class="line"><!---->	error = device_create_file(dev, &amp;dev_attr_uevent);<!----></span><br>	if (error)<span class="line"><!---->	if (error)<!----></span><br>		goto attrError;<span class="line"><!---->		goto attrError;<!----></span><br><br>	error = device_add_class_symlinks(dev);<span class="line"><!---->	error = device_add_class_symlinks(dev);<!----></span><br>	if (error)<span class="line"><!---->	if (error)<!----></span><br>		goto SymlinkError;<span class="line"><!---->		goto SymlinkError;<!----></span><br>	error = device_add_attrs(dev);<span class="line"><!---->	error = device_add_attrs(dev);<!----></span><br>	if (error)<span class="line"><!---->	if (error)<!----></span><br>		goto AttrsError;<span class="line"><!---->		goto AttrsError;<!----></span><br>	error = bus_add_device(dev);<span class="line"><!---->	error = bus_add_device(dev);<!----></span><br>	if (error)<span class="line"><!---->	if (error)<!----></span><br>		goto BusError;<span         Not really any. I rarely work on kernels these days and priority is set to 3. Is this urgent?<span class="line"><!---->Not really any. I rarely work on kernels these days and priority is set to 3. Is this urgent?<!----></span><br><br>So I took a look today but I found both the crashing task and the freeing task actually has hci_dev_lock, so not sure what's causing the crash.<span class="line"><!---->So I took a look today but I found both the crashing task and the freeing task actually has hci_dev_lock, so not sure what's causing the crash.<!----></span><br><br>int hci_dev_close_sync(struct hci_dev *hdev)<span class="line"><!---->int hci_dev_close_sync(struct hci_dev *hdev)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	...<span class="line"><!---->	...<!----></span><br>	hci_dev_lock(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->	hci_dev_lock(hdev);<!----></span><br><br>	hci_discovery_set_state(hdev, DISCOVERY_STOPPED);<span class="line"><!---->	hci_discovery_set_state(hdev, DISCOVERY_STOPPED);<!----></span><br><br>	auto_off = hci_dev_test_and_clear_flag(hdev, HCI_AUTO_OFF);<span class="line"><!---->	auto_off = hci_dev_test_and_clear_flag(hdev, HCI_AUTO_OFF);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!auto_off && hdev->dev_type == HCI_PRIMARY &&<span class="line"><!---->	if (!auto_off &amp;&amp; hdev-&gt;dev_type == HCI_PRIMARY &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>	    !hci_dev_test_flag(hdev, HCI_USER_CHANNEL) &&<span class="line"><!---->	    !hci_dev_test_flag(hdev, HCI_USER_CHANNEL) &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>	    hci_dev_test_flag(hdev, HCI_MGMT))<span class="line"><!---->	    hci_dev_test_flag(hdev, HCI_MGMT))<!----></span><br>		__mgmt_power_off(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->		__mgmt_power_off(hdev);<!----></span><br><br>	hci_inquiry_cache_flush(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->	hci_inquiry_cache_flush(hdev);<!----></span><br>	hci_pend_le_actions_clear(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->	hci_pend_le_actions_clear(hdev);<!----></span><br>	hci_conn_hash_flush(hdev);              // <-- CRASHING STACKTRACE<span class="line"><!---->	hci_conn_hash_flush(hdev);              // &lt;-- CRASHING STACKTRACE<!----></span><br>	/* Prevent data races on hdev->smp_data or hdev->smp_bredr_data */<span class="line"><!---->	/* Prevent data races on hdev-&gt;smp_data or hdev-&gt;smp_bredr_data */<!----></span><br>	smp_unregister(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->	smp_unregister(hdev);<!----></span><br>	hci_dev_unlock(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->	hci_dev_unlock(hdev);<!----></span><br>	...<span class="line"><!---->	...<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>static void hci_le_cis_estabilished_evt(struct hci_dev *hdev, void *data,<span class="line"><!---->static void hci_le_cis_estabilished_evt(struct hci_dev *hdev, void *data,<!----></span><br>					struct sk_buff *skb)<span class="line"><!---->					struct sk_buff *skb)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	...<span class="line"><!---->	...<!----></span><br>	hci_dev_lock(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->	hci_dev_lock(hdev);<!----></span><br>	...<span class="line"><!---->	...<!----></span><br>	if (!ev->status) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (!ev-&gt;status) {<!----></span><br>		conn->state = BT_CONNECTED;<span class="line"><!---->		conn-&gt;state = BT_CONNECTED;<!----></span><br>		hci_debugfs_create_conn(conn);<span class="line"><!---->		hci_debugfs_create_conn(conn);<!----></span><br>		hci_conn_add_sysfs(conn);                 // <-- FREEING STACKTRACE<span class="line"><!---->		hci_conn_add_sysfs(conn);                 // &lt;-- FREEING STACKTRACE<!----></span><br>		hci_iso_setup_path(conn);<span class="line"><!---->		hci_iso_setup_path(conn);<!----></span><br>		goto unlock;<span class="line"><!---->		goto unlock;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	hci_connect_cfm(conn, ev->status);<span class="line"><!---->	hci_connect_cfm(conn, ev-&gt;status);<!----></span><br>	hci_conn_del(conn);<span class="line"><!---->	hci_conn_del(conn);<!----></span><br><br>unlock:<span class="line"><!---->unlock:<!----></span><br>	hci_dev_unlock(hdev);<span class="line"><!---->	hci_dev_unlock(hdev);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>

        And this is a local kernel privilege escalation vulnerability, not a code execution vulnerability. The key point is to escalate privileges. Only developers who use root to grant code execution permissions can execute this exploit. Or cooperate with the chrome sandbox to escape and execute this vulnerability to perform privilege escalation operations<span class="line"><!---->And this is a local kernel privilege escalation vulnerability, not a code execution vulnerability.         </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        IIUC this requires winning a race based on when devices are added. What would it take for the attacker to reach this?         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.       </div>
      The hci_error_reset and hci_rx_work are two worker threads, so there is a possibility of race conditions. hci_error_reset will eventually call device_del, hci_rx_work will eventually call device_add, so there is a race condition vulnerability between [0] and [1],[2]<span class="line"><!---->The hci_error_reset and hci_rx_work are two worker threads, so there is a possibility of race conditions. hci_error_reset will eventually call device_del, hci_rx_work will eventually call device_add, so there is a race condition vulnerability between [0] and [1],[2]<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/drivers/base/core.c;l=3571<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/drivers/base/core.c;l=3571"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/drivers/base/core.c;l=3571<!----></a><br>int device_add(struct device *dev)<span class="line"><!---->int device_add(struct device *dev)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct device *parent;<span class="line"><!---->	struct device *parent;<!----></span><br>	struct kobject *kobj;<span class="line"><!---->	struct kobject *kobj;<!----></span><br>	struct class_interface *class_intf;<span class="line"><!---->	struct class_interface *class_intf;<!----></span><br>	int error = -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->	int error = -EINVAL;<!----></span><br>	struct kobject *glue_dir = NULL;<span class="line"><!---->	struct kobject *glue_dir = NULL;<!----></span><br><br>	dev = get_device(dev);<span class="line"><!---->	dev = get_device(dev);<!----></span><br>	if (!dev)<span class="line"><!---->	if (!dev)<!----></span><br>		goto done;<span class="line"><!---->		goto done;<!----></span><br><br>	if (!dev->p) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (!dev-&gt;p) {<!----></span><br>		error = device_private_init(dev);<span class="line"><!---->		error = device_private_init(dev);<!----></span><br>		if (error)<span class="line"><!---->		if (error)<!----></span><br>			goto done;<span class="line"><!---->			goto done;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	/*<span class="line"><!---->	/*<!----></span><br>	 * for statically allocated devices, which should all be converted<span class="line"><!---->	 * for statically allocated devices, which should all be converted<!----></span><br>	 * some day, we need to initialize the name. We prevent reading back<span class="line"><!---->	 * some day, we need to initialize the name.         448a496f7606 should address the symptoms of this problem. It won't address the root cause; that is hidden somewhere in the bluetooth code. The error handler is known to be racy, and the bluetooth code should under no circumstance attempt to create the same sysfs attribute file twice.<span class="line"><!---->448a496f7606 should address the symptoms of this problem. It won't address the root cause; that is hidden somewhere in the bluetooth code.         You are right that we have the first patch in the series, I was searching for the second patch in the series:<span class="line"><!---->You are right that we have the first patch in the series, class="undefined" target="_blank"         And this is a local kernel privilege escalation vulnerability, not a code execution vulnerability. The key point is to escalate privileges.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.     <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->

        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Nov 4, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Nov 4, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Nov 4, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by hacky...@gmail.com (Nov 4, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      The hci_error_reset and hci_rx_work are two worker threads, so there is a possibility of race conditions. hci_error_reset will eventually call device_del, hci_rx_work will eventually call device_add, so there is a race condition vulnerability between [0] and [1],[2]<span class="line"><!---->The hci_error_reset and hci_rx_work are two worker threads, so there is a possibility of race conditions. hci_error_reset will eventually call device_del, hci_rx_work will eventually call device_add, so there is a race condition vulnerability between [0] and [1],[2]<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/upstream/drivers/base/core.c;l=3571<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         448a496f7606 should address the symptoms of this problem. It won't address the root cause; that is hidden somewhere in the bluetooth code. The error handler is known to be racy, and the bluetooth code should under no circumstance attempt to create the same sysfs attribute file twice.<span class="line"><!---->448a496f7606 should address the symptoms of this problem. It won't address the root cause; that is hidden somewhere in the bluetooth code. The error handler is known to be racy, and the bluetooth code should under no circumstance attempt to create the same sysfs attribute file twice.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        And this is a local kernel privilege escalation vulnerability, not a code execution vulnerability. The key point is to escalate privileges. Only developers who use root to grant code execution permissions can execute this exploit. Or cooperate with the chrome sandbox to escape and execute this vulnerability to perform privilege escalation operations<span class="line"><!---->And this is a local kernel privilege escalation vulnerability, not a code execution vulnerability.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.     <mr-launch-overview class="main-item" hidden=""><!---->
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>

        <slot></slot>
      </label>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
